Class GridGenerator

java.lang.Object
GridGenerator
class GridGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
Class that's used to generate random sudoku grid. Class produces random solved grid, and then takes given number of elements out generating random game grid.

  • Field Summary

  • Constructor Details

    • GridGenerator

      GridGenerator​(int nums)
      Constructor causes generation of random grid of given numbers missing.
      Parameters:
      nums - Amount of numbers to be missing from game cell.

  • Method Details

    • generateGrid

      private void generateGrid()
      Generation of grid in two steps. First step is to fill three diagonal squares (top-left, middle and low-right). That makes randomizing sudoku, because those squared do not impact each other. Second step is to fill remaining six squares, which requires whole grid awareness.

    • fillDiagonal

      private void fillDiagonal()
      Filling 3 diagonal squares from top left to bottom-right.

    • fillSquare

      private void fillSquare​(int row, int column)
      Filling square with random numbers of 1-9 with regard only for square
      Parameters:
      row - Top square's cells row.
      column - The most left square's column.

    • isUsedInBox

      private boolean isUsedInBox​(int rowStart, int colStart, int num)
      Checking if given number has been already used in certain square.
      Parameters:
      rowStart - Square top row's number.
      colStart - Square's most left column number.
      num - Number to be checked.
      Returns:
      boolean true if is already used.

    • fillRemaining

      private boolean fillRemaining​(int i, int j)
      Recursive function to fill whole grid with random numbers, but strict with game rules.
      Parameters:
      i - row number
      j - column number
      Returns:
      true if end is reached.
      See Also:
      Used to check number validity

    • removeKDigits

      private void removeKDigits()
      Used to remove numbers from random cell.

    • getReadyGrid

      int[][] getReadyGrid()

    • getSolvedGrid

      int[][] getSolvedGrid()

    • printSudoku

      void printSudoku()
